author: Special Correspondent
text:
Rohith Vemula’s guide has drawn himself into a controversy after he shared on Facebook a post against the protest demanding justice for his student.

The post which Associate Professor Raghav Reddy of the Department of Sociology shared was that of his Facebook friend. “It is not the first time somebody committed suicide on HCU campus. It is not the first time students got suspended… but it is the first time we are seeing a big nationwide drama.” The post was also critical of the “anti-BJP groups” which were silent when other suicides had occurred. “…Many students of this university are influenced by radical Left ideologies, but they never mounted such a feisty campaign when those Dalit students took their lives,” the post said.

The post blamed the Congress and the CPI(M) for “playing with Dalit students sentiments”.
title: Row over online post
